rename.from: enhancement: Use same or relative path for backups when files will be modified/deleted
rename.to: Use same or relative path for backups when files will be modified/deleted: --suffix without --backup-dir

body:
> I think it would be awesome if `rclone` could make backups in the same folder as the original file and/or a folder relative to the same folder.

All the above was for "same folder".

I think relative to the same folder is probably a different issue - let's get "same folder" out the way first.
Awesome. Thanks. I will play with it this weekend. And I agree on the relative folder comment. Baby steps.

issue.title: [WIP] Implement --suffix without --backup-dir for current dir

issue.title: --backup-dir doesn't work for single file copy/move

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`rclone.1` [says](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/a0d4fdb2fa34c7f6ac5a86021d16403713499aaf/rclone.1#L4547) `--backup-dir` works for "sync, copy or move", but in fact it only works for `sync`. From the code it seems this option is only implemented for `sync`, and if that is the case the doc should be refined.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.47.0-074-g81fad0f0-beta
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.12.5
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

`Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster), x86_64`

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Any backends should be the same.

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone -vv move myfile remote:afolder --backup-dir remote:backupdir`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2019/05/22 16:21:52 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.47.0-074-g81fad0f0-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "move" "myfile" "remote:afolder" "--backup-dir" "remote:backupdir"]
2019/05/22 16:21:52 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/me/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2019/05/22 16:21:56 DEBUG : myfile: Sizes differ (src 30217 vs dst 3218)
2019/05/22 16:21:56 DEBUG : myfile: Starting multipart upload
2019/05/22 16:21:56 DEBUG : myfile: Uploading segment 0/30217 size 30217
2019/05/22 16:21:57 INFO  : myfile: Copied (replaced existing)
2019/05/22 16:21:57 INFO  : myfile: Deleted
2019/05/22 16:21:57 INFO  :
Transferred:       29.509k / 29.509 kBytes, 100%, 5.984 kBytes/s, ETA 0s
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 2 / 2, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        4.9s

2019/05/22 16:21:57 DEBUG : 9 go routines active
2019/05/22 16:21:57 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.47.0-074-g81fad0f0-beta" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "move" "myfile" "remote:afolder" "--backup-dir" "remote:backupdir"]
```

issue.title: Backup dir

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

1. Refactor the BackupDir checks so they apply to Move and Copy command not only Sync

2. allow --suffix by itself to add suffix and backup files in current directory
<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

BackupDir change was discussed in #3219

suffix change was discussed in #2801
<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
